title: For Sale:  Remington SPR453, 12 Gauge
postcontent: This is a Remington SPR453 made by Baikal in Russia. This model is identical to the Baikal MP153, it was imported by Remington and sold as the SPR453. Due to their durability people don’t get rid of them, making them hard to find. They are a gas operated semi automatic shotgun with adjustment mechanism that allows it to Shoot any 12 gauge load from 2 3/4 inch Trap Loads all the way up to 3 1/2 inch Magnums. Barrel is 28 inch Vent Rib with removable chokes. Baikal thread choke tubes are readily available on the internet this one has the TSMOD, which is the most versatile. Magazine capacity 4 + 1 capacity on 2 3/4 inch shells or 3+1 with 3 1/2 inch shells. Weight empty on this shotgun is 7 pounds 8 ounces. Bore, chamber, and mechanism are all bright and clean.  This YouTube video will demonstrate why this will be the last shotgun you ever buy. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qt1QV3DFUrQ

title: For Sale/Trade:  Kahr P9 / PM9 "Commander"
postcontent:
Kahr P9 stippled frame, with a Kahr PM9 slide.

The modifications are a custom job that the previous owner had done.  You can see his ad for this gun at  http://www.armslist.com/posts/3706540/colorado-springs-colorado-handguns-for-sale-trade--kahr-pm9---p9-hybrid-8-magazines-stippled-   
(scroll down pas the "Try these listings instead" message).

$399 for Kahr, two 7-round magazines, and two holsters (one is pictured below).

$499 for all of above, plus six 8-round magazines.  ( Kahr K920, $44 each at  http://www.kahr.com/Magazines/Kahr-8-Round-9mm-Magazine-K920.asp  )

The 8-round magazines do stick out from the bottom of the grip.   Pearce finger-rests are available from Kahr for $15/pair  (  http://www.kahr.com//grips/kahr-pearce-grip.asp ) if you prefer them.

Why am I selling this:  I was trying to sell a Ruger LCR-22 revolver, and the previous owner offered to trade for this.  Since I wasn't having any luck selling the LCR, I bought this with the intention to sell it, hoping to have better luck than I did with the Ruger.

Caveats:  the frame is not uniformly colored.  It's as though somebody applied some type of black finish (over the black plastic) and the finish is wearing off.  The previous owner claims it's just "holster wear".   Also, I shot 50 rounds out of this to test it.  It's an extremely accurate gun at 7 yards, but I did have one failure to eject.  I don't know if it's an issue with the gun itself, or that I might have been "limp-wristing" it, since I was concentrating on taking pictures of me shooting it (gun in one hand, camera in the other) instead of paying attention to my grip. 

I can meet you at an FFL dealer of your choice, to conduct the sale in accordance with stupid state laws.  Buyer is responsible for CBI and FFL fees.

EDITED TO ADD:  I do not have the original Kahr box for this.

title: For Sale/Trade:  LIKE NEW HK VP9 V1 W/CUSTOM STIPPLE GRIP....
postcontent:
I HAVE A LIKE NEW HK VP9 VARIANT 1 UP FOR GRABS. THE STIPPLE JOB IS THIS HK IS OUTSTANDING AND WAS MUCH NEEDED AS THE STOCK TEXURE IS WAY TO SLICK. 110RDS DOWN RANGE. COMES WITH BOX, 2 MAGS, PAPERS ECT... PM OR TEXT REDACTED FOR FASTEST RESPONSE...

In development for more than four years, the VP9 is Heckler & Koch’s latest handgun and the first striker fired HK since the renowned P7 series pistols were introduced in the 1980s.

Experience gained by HK engineers with the recent P30 pistol had a direct influence on the design of the VP9, but the VP9 breaks new ground with its integration of a unique striker firing system with an enhanced HK “light pull” trigger. The net result is trigger quality unequaled in any production striker fired handgun.

HK pioneered the first striker fired handguns, producing both the VP70 and P7 series, designs that impacted several models by HK competitors. But a superior trigger has eluded most striker fired pistol designs. The VP9 trigger surpasses those found on competitors. It has a short, light take-up with a solid, single action type break followed by a short positive reset.

The VP9 trigger has a consistent pre-travel pull with a positive wall/crisp break. Typically, striker fired guns have a pre-travel pull that increases in weight as you go through the trigger stroke. With the VP9, you have a less than noticeable pre-travel pull until the trigger reaches the engagement point of the fire control parts prior to trigger break.

The VP9 uses HK’s ergonomic handgun grip design that includes three changeable backstraps and six side panels— accommodating all hand sizes. Molded finger grooves in the front of the pistol’s grip also instinctively position an operator’s hand for optimal shooting. Only HK handguns have such a customized grip.

Although influenced by other HK models, the VP9 has all the hallmarks of the latest, state-of-the-art handgun. All controls are completely ambidextrous. Slide releases are present on both sides of the frame and the magazine release can be easily activated by left- or right-handed shooters.

A new feature is HK’s patented charging supports — simple components that are mounted on each side of the rear of the slide and provide better gripping leverage for racking the slide rearward. The charging supports speed reloading and make operating the VP9 easier for shooters with reduced hand strength. The VP pistols uses the proven P30 steel magazine; 15 and 10-round capacity available.

The VP9 has an extended Picatinny MIL-STD-1913 rail molded into its polymer frame for mounting lights and accessories. The rail has been tested and certified to handle mounted accessories up to 5.6 ounces.

The VP9’s proprietary captive flat recoil spring helps reduce the recoil forces effecting the operator and the handgun, improving shooter control during rapid firing and prolonging component service life.

HK’s famous cold hammer forged barrel — made from cannon grade steel — ensures long service life. Similar HK barrels on 9 mm P30 models have fired more than 90,000 rounds in endurance tests in 2010. The polygonal bore profile, with no traditional lands-and-grooves rifling, contributes to longer service life as well as a slight increase in muzzle velocity.

The VP9’s machined steel slide is protected from corrosion and wear by HK’s hostile environment finish and all metal components, including springs and pins have superior metallurgy.

VP pistols are made in Heckler & Koch’s Oberndorf factory in southwest Germany. The VP9 is well-suited for civilian sport shooting, security, military, and law enforcement use.

Covered by Heckler & Koch’s limited lifetime warranty, the HK VP9 is a solid design engineered with the famous long-term durability that make HK products especially cost-effective when subjected to total life cycle cost analysis. Suggested retail price of the VP9 is $719 with projected availability of July 2014.

title: For Sale:  Sig P938 2 Tone W/ SIG Laser, SIG Holster and Hogue Extreme Grips
postcontent:
With the introduction of the P938, SIG SAUER now offers the ballistic advantage of the 9mm cartridge in a platform similar in size to the best-selling P238 pistol. A single-action-only trigger, coupled with full-size SIGLITE Night Sights makes the P938 handle like a much larger pistol, yet is still easy to carry concealed. With dimensions just slightly larger than its .380ACP counterpart, the P938 packs six plus one rounds of 9mm into an all-metal frame. The cocked-and-locked single-action trigger gives the P938 unmatched accuracy in a pistol its size. Fans of the 1911 will find the thumb safety, magazine release and slide stop lever in familiar places. An ambidextrous safety makes the P938 easy for left- and right-handed shooters. The most compact 9mm in the SIG SAUER product line.
Includes over sized rubber molded grips, SIGLITE Night Sights, Sig Sauer red laser sight, (1) 7 round extended magazine and (1) flush fit 6 round magazine.

postcontent:
The Taurus PT 740 Slim is a semi-automatic small-frame pistol chambered for .40 S&W. The 740 Slim has been praised for its smooth cycling and comfortably compact design by many reviewers. Named “Slim” because of its thin frame. 

Features include three-dot sights that are adjustable for elevation and wind. Several safeties including a trigger safety that prevents the firing pin from punching forward unless the trigger is actually pulled, so if it’s dropped no accidental discharge. A safety switch, just in case, and a lock safety that renders it functionless with a turn of a key. A thumb and index finger groove make for an interesting ergonomic design. There is a thumb indent for the action-hand’s grip and a finger groove along the frame just below the slide to place the passive hand’s index finger.

Why set up a NFA Gun Trust?

 Avoid the intrusion and hassle of being photographed, fingerprinted, and obtaining chief law enforcement officer (CLEO) sign off

 Legally allow others to use your NFA firearm--without a NFA Gun Trust, you cannot let a friend shoot your NFA firearm at the range

 Legally allow others to possess your NFA Firearm--without a NFA Gun Trust, your spouse or roommate cannot have access to your NFA firearm, meaning Your NFA firearm must be locked up in a safe or other secure location which your spouse or roommate cannot access.


Note: NFA Trusts by Hanna Law, P.C.

title: For Sale/Trade:  2 - 7.62x39 rifles
location: East Side of cincy, Cincinnati, Ohio
postcontent:
I have 2 rifles that I am wanting to sell or trade 1 of them, but couldn't decide on which one, so whichever sells first...I'll keep the other.

The first is a Chinese Norinco SKS in great shape, nice clean bore.  It has an ATI Dark Earth stock on it that has an adjustable shoulder stock similar to that of an AR15, and the stock also has the ability to fold the shoulder portion over for a pistol grip. Paid $150 just for the stock.  Comes with 3 - 30 round magazines, 1 metal, 2 polymer.  Price is $475 obo.

The second is a Stainless Ruger Mini 30 Thirty.  It is the nicer style to me with a beautiful wood stock on it and nice stainless flash hider. It comes with 1 factory stainless 10 round magazine.  These rifles are difficult to find.  You can find Mini 14's all day long, and sometimes you can locate a newer Mini 30 with a polymer stock.  But its harder to find the nicer looking stainless barrel with wood stock combo.  Shoots great, looks great. Price on this one is $850 obo.

Call or text anytime, I live in Ohio but have a ky cell phone number REDACTED.  I can prove Ohio residence with license or CCW, although it doesn't matter with a long gun. But if you feel more comfortable, you can call the landline at REDACTED.

Please leave a message if I don't answer.  I have a newborn and can't always get to the phone the second people call, so please leave your name and number.  Thanks for looking

May consider trading both, but would have to be something pretty special

Can send pics by request...internet isn't wanting to load them for some reason.

The regular chest plates are $100 Each and I have 30 side plates remaining in which I have both sizes available from 6"x6" also 6"x8" the side plates cost $20.00 Each. 
The armor actually fit majority plate carriers. Upon Request I will coat the plates if you want.

If you want and if you live too far away. I am able to ship inside of Arizona so that is an option as well. MIL-A-46100 steel is Military spec armor. MIL-A 46100 armor is used to stop high velocity projectiles (HVPs). This particular grade military spec armor steel is especially useful to protect structures or vehicles from sniper fire or any form of weapon that will emit the HVPs depending on the threat level, various thicknesses of steel may be required to protect vital organs.
The measurement of the plates are both
1/4" and .393" also not to mention tested by the US Army test labs.
I used a .308 rifle and a .223 at The Mil-Spec plates at 40 and 50 yards. Then shot it with AK 47 50rnds, 5.56 30rnds, .357/9mm/45cal, 7.62x54R, still no penetration. Not to mention shot at it with a .45 handgun still no penetration. This will not fail to disappoint as it this is one of the best quality steel out there. This is much more sophisticated steel compared to AR500, AR500 is target material. This body armor with the 2 plates and the vest weighs a total of 15 pounds. I've shot at this multiple times with different rifles and Handguns and it still holds up. You could attach MOLLE gear to this vest such as your Hydration water Carrier, Rifle and Handgun Magazine pouches, Radio pouches, EMT Medical pouches and etc.

NOTE: I have six test shot plates if interested to use them for target practice I am selling them for $20.00 Each let me know if you want them thanks.

The 1911 STX from the SIG SAUER Custom Shop is a two-tone 1911 that’s loaded with features. This non-railed pistol features a Nitron® slide over a Natural Stainless frame and with come with VZ g10 grips along with the original wood grain sig grips. Very slightly used (less than 20 rounds) Mossberg 18.5" 590A1 shotgun
Ghost ring sights

1 box (10ea) Winchester PDX1 defender (1oz rifled slug and 3 plated 00buck)

The 590A1 is used by the U.S. and allied armed forces, having been designed to meet the stricter standards outlined by the U.S. Military.

The Model 590A1 has an aluminum trigger guard & safety, a heavier barrel, and a bayonet lug, intended for military use under extreme conditions and rough handling; the metal trigger guard was added in response to the 3443G materials requirements, and the heavy barrel was added at the request of the Navy to prevent barrel deformation if the shotgun caught in the closing of heavy steel ship doors. 

The 590A1 is generally sold through military and law enforcement channels, though the 18.5-inch model is available and may be legally purchased by any non prohibited persons.

One of the top rated, most rugged and dependable personal defense shotguns available.

title: For Sale/Trade:  1983 Jeep Cherokee "BUG OUT VEHICLE"
postcontent:
Testing Waters. I have here a running and driving 1983 Jeep Cherokee that Im looking to sell or trade. This is the last of the FSJ's(full size jeep), they continued to make Wagoneers but changed the design of the Cherokee. It has a 4.2 straight six(has had emissions bypassed and miles of vacume lines removed), Tranny shifts smooth, four wheel drive engages and works flawlessly. The body is in good shape. Has some minor surface rust throughout the vehicle on the outside. Only spots where there is rust through holes is behind the rear wheels(you can get cut out panels off the internet for $75 a side) also 1 bad spot on passenger side above rocker. The underbody is scaly, but not rusted out. Body is actually in great shape! Interior is all original, the floor pans are in great shape. The rear hatch has some minor rust and the back bed has 2 little rust through holes. All glass is intaced and functioning, this model does not have electric windows, it is crank windows all the way around including rear. Tires are in good shape. Heat works, but no AC. I love this truck, but am going a different route. She will go through anything, It is in way better shape then most you will find around here. Odometer shows 149xxx. Previous ownwer had it painted flat black and there is some primer shots covering where surface rust areas had been, interior paint is a light metalic blue so Im guessing thats the original color! Tabs are current and she drives down the road just fine(You could drive home). Make me a offer, I have people stop and ask about it all the time!!! Needs some TLC but is a F***ing awesome truck!! I can send more pics upon request(this is all I could fit)
These trucks are hard to find in decent condition!! $1500 cash FIRM!

title: For Sale:  WALTHER PPK ~ VERY RARE PDM MODEL ~ COLLECTOR'S PIECE
postcontent:
Owner is offering for sale a very rare PDM model PPK handgun chambered in 7.65 mm. The PDM (Police Direction Munich) edition was used exclusively by Heinrich Himmler's Munich Police starting in the mid-1930's. Himmler later was appointed by Adolf Hitler to command the notorious SS Storm Troopers during WWII. 

This rare piece was one of only 450 ever produced. The pistol is in excellent working condition, and has only been fired a few times since its acquisition in 1956. This is a highly desirable collector's piece that would be a nice addition to any collection.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Pre-ban Egyptian Maadi MISR AK-47
postcontent:
I have a pre-ban Egyptian Maadi AK-47 in 7.62x39.  It comes with the original wood furniture and original 10-round magazine in the original plastic bag in the original box (although the box has survived many cross-country moves so it's getting pretty beat up with a hole in one side).  I can't find the original manual or accessories (sling, etc) although I can include a Russian sling with it if you want.  It does have the original cleaning rod in place, and has a rare threaded barrel (with the thread protector still welded on over the top as imported).

I took this in trade and was told it was new, but it shows some minor wear to the butt plate on the stock, and a little inside the receiver.  However, the usual safety arc is only just starting to appear, which usually happens after flipping the safety a couple times, so it really could be unfired still and the previous owner just didn't take good enough care of it.  I have never personally fired it, but I found a different AK-47 variant so I don't need to keep this one anymore.  If you know anything about these, you know they sell in decent used condition without the original extras for $750-1000.  This is NOT a Century WASR, so please don't send me similar offers, but cash talks.  I can also accept a credit card in person for no extra fee if you'd rather pay that way.

It will take most, if not all, double-stack AK-47 mags including Romanian and Korean drums, Magpul mags, etc.

If you send me an e-mail with a lowball offer, asking what my bottom dollar is, if I'll accept something else in trade, or if this is still available, you will not get a response.  I am willing to travel as far west as Johnson Creek or up to Cabela's in Richfield if you're not local.  I will also ship this on your dime (directly to you if you live in Wisconsin, or to an FFL in another state as allowed by Federal law).

title: For Sale:  Smith & Wesson Model 29-2 Dirty Harry Commemorative Ivory Grips &24k Inlay. 1 of a Kind Unfired!
postcontent: This listing is for a beautiful one of a kind unfired Smith and Wesson 6.5" model 29-2 .44 magnum engraved by Joseph Condon aka "Engraver to the Stars" (now deceased). The entire gun was designed, engraved and inlaid with solid gold by Condon in 1981 (see signature and date in trigger guard). Grips are scrimshaw engraved solid IVORY. The engraving commemorates the Clint Eastwood movies "Dirty Harry" "Magnum Force" and "The Enforcer". Condon considered this piece to be his lifetime masterpiece. The pistol shows a gold figure of Dirty Harry with his Model 29 in high relief 3D gold which literally comes out of the revolver frame. There is also a man-sized target in the background. There is a gold figure of Alcatraz, the Warner Brothers logo and the Golden Gate Bridge. Included with the gun is a plaque describing the design which was made by Condon with the gun (see photos). The gun is in perfect condition.

postcontent:
Werkz LLC manufactures quality gear for the armed citizen.  We are based in Idaho, but ship to gun stores and individuals around the country.  We have a huge selection of Kydex colors and patterns (currently 32), and a huge selection of available pistol molds (over 110 different pistols) and lights (over ten).  Check us out if you need quality custom gear delivered in a reasonable time, currently around two weeks.

We have the Origin holster line, which is built for OWB (outside the waistband) carry, but can be converted to IWB (inside the waistband), or even attached to webbing using optional straps.  In addition, we have the Origin mag carriers which use the same accessories.

We have the Minimalist holsters for IWB or AIWB (appendix) carry.

title: For Sale/Trade:  HK VP9 V1 "LIKE NEW"
postcontent:
I HAVE A LIKE NEW HK VP9 VARIANT 1 UP FOR GRABS. THE STIPPLE JOB IS THIS HK IS OUTSTANDING AND WAS MUCH NEEDED AS THE STOCK TEXURE IS WAY TO SLICK. 110RDS DOWN RANGE. COMES WITH BOX, 2 MAGS, PAPERS ECT... PM OR TEXT REDACTED FOR FASTEST RESPONSE...

In development for more than four years, the VP9 is Heckler & Koch’s latest handgun and the first striker fired HK since the renowned P7 series pistols were introduced in the 1980s.

Experience gained by HK engineers with the recent P30 pistol had a direct influence on the design of the VP9, but the VP9 breaks new ground with its integration of a unique striker firing system with an enhanced HK “light pull” trigger. The net result is trigger quality unequaled in any production striker fired handgun.

HK pioneered the first striker fired handguns, producing both the VP70 and P7 series, designs that impacted several models by HK competitors. But a superior trigger has eluded most striker fired pistol designs. The VP9 trigger surpasses those found on competitors. It has a short, light take-up with a solid, single action type break followed by a short positive reset.

The VP9 trigger has a consistent pre-travel pull with a positive wall/crisp break. Typically, striker fired guns have a pre-travel pull that increases in weight as you go through the trigger stroke. With the VP9, you have a less than noticeable pre-travel pull until the trigger reaches the engagement point of the fire control parts prior to trigger break.

The VP9 uses HK’s ergonomic handgun grip design that includes three changeable backstraps and six side panels— accommodating all hand sizes. Molded finger grooves in the front of the pistol’s grip also instinctively position an operator’s hand for optimal shooting. Only HK handguns have such a customized grip.

Although influenced by other HK models, the VP9 has all the hallmarks of the latest, state-of-the-art handgun. All controls are completely ambidextrous. Slide releases are present on both sides of the frame and the magazine release can be easily activated by left- or right-handed shooters.

A new feature is HK’s patented charging supports — simple components that are mounted on each side of the rear of the slide and provide better gripping leverage for racking the slide rearward. The charging supports speed reloading and make operating the VP9 easier for shooters with reduced hand strength. The VP pistols uses the proven P30 steel magazine; 15 and 10-round capacity available.

The VP9 has an extended Picatinny MIL-STD-1913 rail molded into its polymer frame for mounting lights and accessories. The rail has been tested and certified to handle mounted accessories up to 5.6 ounces.

The VP9’s proprietary captive flat recoil spring helps reduce the recoil forces effecting the operator and the handgun, improving shooter control during rapid firing and prolonging component service life.

HK’s famous cold hammer forged barrel — made from cannon grade steel — ensures long service life. Similar HK barrels on 9 mm P30 models have fired more than 90,000 rounds in endurance tests in 2010. The polygonal bore profile, with no traditional lands-and-grooves rifling, contributes to longer service life as well as a slight increase in muzzle velocity.

The VP9’s machined steel slide is protected from corrosion and wear by HK’s hostile environment finish and all metal components, including springs and pins have superior metallurgy.

VP pistols are made in Heckler & Koch’s Oberndorf factory in southwest Germany. The VP9 is well-suited for civilian sport shooting, security, military, and law enforcement use.

Covered by Heckler & Koch’s limited lifetime warranty, the HK VP9 is a solid design engineered with the famous long-term durability that make HK products especially cost-effective when subjected to total life cycle cost analysis. Suggested retail price of the VP9 is $719 with projected availability of July 2014.

title: For Sale:  CZ 452 + Brno sights + other extras
postcontent:
Due to an unfortunate financial predicament I placed myself (read: college), I'm selling one of my favorite rifles, a CZ 452 that was born as a Lux but has gone through some of changes in its life. I originally bought this rifle from a guy a couple years ago, and he did a trigger job complete with brass shims. I don't have a way to measure it, but it's light and extremely crisp. I believe (can't remember 100%) that he also polished the action, but if not, it's still very, very slick. I added Brno sights from Denny Jakubec, took off the modified walnut Varmint stock and replaced it with a new beech Ultra Lux stock. 

Included you'll get:

CZ 452 Lux w/Ultra Lux stock
Brno match sights
Gehmann box with two new apertures and the original front sight parts
Brno steel single-shot adapter
Three steel five-round magazines
One polymer five-round magazine
Modified walnut Varmint stock bedded to fit the action
Original owners manual

I've tried to take enough photos to get all areas of the gun so you know exactly what you're buying. There are no mechanical problems with the gun, just some minor aesthetic issues on the action and front sight base. Also included the only target photo I have, from when I was sighting in the gun (which is why the group is nowhere near the center of the target). That was a five-round group shot with Federal #510 ammo at 50 yards.

I'm asking $600 or best offer, including shipping via USPS priority mail with $600 of insurance. Take off $50 for a face-to-face deal within 30 minutes of Greenville, Texas.
